comments.body:
On 2.5's version of ec2_group this task fails with 
```
The full traceback is:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/ansible_PZciUL/ansible_module_ec2_group.py", line 994, in <module>
    main()
  File "/tmp/ansible_PZciUL/ansible_module_ec2_group.py", line 833, in main
    group, groups, vpc_id)
  File "/tmp/ansible_PZciUL/ansible_module_ec2_group.py", line 430, in get_target_from_rule
    auto_group = client.create_security_group(**params)
  File "/Users/shertel/Workspace/ansible/venv/python2.7.13/lib/python2.7/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 314, in _api_call
    return self._make_api_call(operation_name, kwargs)
  File "/Users/shertel/Workspace/ansible/venv/python2.7.13/lib/python2.7/site-packages/botocore/client.py", line 612, in _make_api_call
    raise error_class(parsed_response, operation_name)
botocore.exceptions.ClientError: An error occurred (InvalidGroup.Duplicate) when calling the CreateSecurityGroup operation: The security group 'ansible-test-macbook-pro-91516652-auto-create-3' already exists for VPC 'vpc-5fea9a37'
```
but I don't understand why... it doesn't look like it should. This branch fixes it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +72,76 @@          - result is failed

    - name: Create a group with a target of a separate group
      ec2_group:
        name: '{{ec2_group_name}}-auto-create-1'

comments.body: Maybe we should add an `ignore_errors: '{{ ansible_version < 2.6 }}` here, or a syntactically correct equivalent.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +86,90 @@        <<: *aws_connection_info
        state: present
      register: result

    - name: Create a 4th group

comments.body: TODO: comment why this block is duplicated
